reviewText: This series is very exciting. It is good to know Amazon has many if the episodes at the touch of one click
So far we love all the seasons.  Keep  them coming!  Makes a great movie night and keeps you thinking about how crazy people are..

I've been watching the other available Forensic Files and enjoying them.  The only issue I have with this one is that it's only 6 episodes long.  I expect that it will be updated eventually.
The best part of this is the update on the Mia Zapata case.  I remember this being presented on Unsolved Mysteries and that many people considered her to be a strong singer, possibly as influential as Kurt Cobain to the grunge music scene.
They use solid forensic science and you don't usually hear about the first time someone's tried a new technique. However, one of the weaknesses of the show is that it becomes pretty easy to tell who the culprit is, but that's probably due to episodes only being a little over 20 minutes long.
I love this show!

I love these shows. It's amazing how tiny amounts of forensic evidence can be used to obtain arrests and convictions. I've never seen a Forensic Files show that I didn't like. You won't be disappointed.

Season 12 continues the excellence of prior seasons. Real crimes and heroic cops and technicians explaining how they find the culprits from the most minute bits of evidence, using amazing equipment and techniques, especially DNA, chemical analysis, etc. It makes you wonder how anybody can ever get away with murder.

This show continues to fascinate me.  The interaction between the real life scenes and images all tied together with the limited portrayals designed to tie the pieces together make it better than most scripted shows like CSI, etc.
Best shows ever. Totally addicted to it. They need more seasons!!!
